titleStmt.title: 432 Performance Measures for Associative Memories that Learn and Forget

affiliation.orgName: University of Hawaii at Manoa Honolulu HI

analytic.title: 432 Performance Measures for Associative Memories that Learn and Forget

abstract.p: Recently, many modifications to the McCulloch/Pitts model have been proposed where both learning and forgetting occur. Given that the network never saturates (ceases to function effectively due to an overload of information), the learning updates can continue indefinitely. For these networks, we need to introduce performance measmes in addition to the information capacity to evaluate the different networks. We mathematically define quantities such as the plasticity of a network, the efficacy of an information vector, and the probability of network saturation. From these quantities we analytically compare different networks.
